intro: Greenea vietnamensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese greenea, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Greenea vietnamensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
